li.a: New York State Sex Offender Registry

p.span: Ellicottville Central School has set up a direct number and email where you can reach the school to leave messages while the school is closed due to COVID-19. Messages will be checked daily on weekdays. Please leave a short message, your name and your number/e-mail address. Someone will get back to you as soon as possible.

span.em: Did you miss the 4/16 Delivery or Do you Need to Pick up Items?

div.div: You may have received a call today that the school has some items for your family that we were unable to deliver. Or, when the busses returned we found bags that had fallen under the seat and were missed at delivery time.
Those items are available for pick up today between 3:30 and 5:00 this afternoon.

You do not need an appointment to do this. Just pull up to the High School Gym Foyer which is located next to the Bus Garage. These doors are at the back of the building, not the ones by the cafeteria. Look for the orange cones to the right of the bus garage.
If there is a car in front of you, please simply wait for them to pull away before you proceed to the entrance.

If you are unable to pick these items up today, please either call the COVID-19 direct line at (716)699-6052 or use the new COVID-19 email address to leave a message. We will reach out to you directly as soon as we can to make other arrangements.

p.span: We will be delivering a new round of student work on Thursday, April 16th. We will also be dropping off the contents of desks and lockers that we were unable to drop off on Monday.

li.span: We will be following the same delivery procedures that we have been using.
Busses will depart the school at 12:15 PM.
West Valley and Franklinville students’ pick will be in the Ellicottville BOCES Parking Lot from 12:30 PM – 1:30 PM.
Salamanca student’s pick-up will be the Green Gables parking lot from 2:30 PM -4:00 PM.
Cattaraugus / Little Valley and students from all other districts can pick up items at the HS Gym Foyer Entrance located next to the bus garage from 1:00 PM– 3:00 PM.

p.span: Please note: assignments being distributed will be for new material and some of it will be graded. More information will be coming regarding collection procedures and grading policies in the near future. For the time being, students with paper packets should store completed work in the folder it was delivered in. Students working on computers should store all completed work on the hard drive of their computer.

We also need to collect the memory sticks from the last delivery so that they can be reused. Students should ensure that they have saved a copy of all their work on their hard drive or have a printed copy before returning the memory stick. Do not try to turn in work on the memory stick. When the busses drop off new materials, the driver will have an orange bucket for you to put the memory stick in.

span.p: Desks and lockers have been packed up and the contents will be delivered on Monday, April 13th.

ul.li: Deliveries will be made to the permanent residence of In-District students, regardless of whether the student normally rides the bus.
We will be following the same procedures we used to drop off homework packets.
Busses will depart the school at 12:15 PM, so please be on the look-out, as we will not make a delivery if there is not someone there to receive it.

strong.u: If you are a non-resident family, we are setting up 3 pick-up locations:

ul.li: West Valley and Franklinville families can pick up their items in the Ellicottville BOCES Parking Lot from 12:30 PM – 1:30 PM.
Salamanca families can pick up their items in the Green Gables parking lot from 2:30 PM -4:00 PM.
Cattaraugus / Little Valley and families from all other districts can pick up items at the HS Gym Foyer Entrance located next to the bus garage from 1:00 PM– 3:00 PM.

strong.u: Please remember, for safety and security reasons, each family may only pick up their family’s items.

span.p: We will contact families that were not at home for delivery or who did not pick-up their items at a drop-off location on Tuesday, April 14th to make arrangements for delivery / pick-up of items.

We tried our best to match up other items from lockers with students, however there may be some mistakes. If you receive an item that is not yours or your child is expecting an item, but did not receive it, call 699-6052 and leave a message, or send an e-mail to bmiller@eville.wnyric.org. We will contact you on Tuesday, April 14th to make arrangements for delivery / pick-up of items.

If you are a parent or caregiver who needs child care, please complete this parent need for child care survey. Based on the information you provide about your job, employer, number of children, and financial need, OCFS may be able to help you find the child program you need. It may be a challenge to find child care due to COVID-19 related program closures, however the staff at OCFS are trying their best to support families to find the high quality child care that they need.
